body:
A similar error happens when I run Doccano on Heroku (with the default _Deploy to Heroku_ button): when clicking "create", a JS error occurs and nothing happens.

```
projects.js:14 TypeError: this.$t is not a function
    at a.create (projects.js:8)
    at click (projects.js:8)
    at Ve (projects.js:14)
    at HTMLButtonElement.n (projects.js:14)
    at HTMLButtonElement.Yr.o._wrapper (projects.js:14)
Je @ projects.js:14
Ke @ projects.js:14
ze @ projects.js:14
Ve @ projects.js:14
n @ projects.js:14
Yr.o._wrapper @ projects.js:14
```

Hello !
Same error for me when I do :

> docker pull chakkiworks/doccano
> docker run -d --rm --name doccano   -e "ADMIN_USERNAME=admin"   -e "ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@example.com"   -e "ADMIN_PASSWORD=password"   -p 8000:8000 chakkiworks/doccano


`
TypeError: this.$t is not a function
    at a.create (projects.js:8)
    at click (projects.js:8
    at Ve (projects.js:14)
    at HTMLButtonElement.n (projects.js:14)
    at HTMLButtonElement.Yr.o._wrapper (projects.js:14)
Je @ projects.js:14
Ke @ projects.js:14
ze @ projects.js:14
Ve @ projects.js:14
n @ projects.js:14
Yr.o._wrapper @ projects.js:14
`

@letnotimitateothers 
Hello! I find this error with DockerToolbox that works on Windows10 home. What's your environment? Same as me?

To work around this, I rolled back to the tagged `v1.0.5` release and then picked up this change, and that version worked for me: https://github.com/doccano/doccano/commit/8a350c7cdcd60da5648c493d507688a2ca8a940c

issue.title: Can not create a project in doccano

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
-----------------------

### System information
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Windows 10 professional 64 bits
- **Python version**:  3.6

###
I am working on labelling classification dataset using doccano. I installed a docker desktop for windows and followed instructions provided [here](https://doccano.github.io/doccano/getting-started/):
- create a docker container for doccano :
`docker pull doccano/doccano
docker container create --name doccano \
  -e "ADMIN_USERNAME=admin" \
  -e "ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@example.com" \
  -e "ADMIN_PASSWORD=password" \
  -p 8000:8000 doccano/doccano`

Then , I start Doccano by running the container : 
`docker container start doccano`.
After these steps, when I try to create a project, nothing happen when I click on "create" button. How can I resolve this problem ?
Thanks

body:
@pjbull Solution worked for me. I pushed the image to Docker Hub so changing `doccano/doccano` to `markuspoerschke/doccano:1.0.5` will temporarily fix the issue.

https://hub.docker.com/layers/markuspoerschke/doccano/1.0.5/images/sha256-917ce1a61b7c508546d5700ff88e79e07b4542e5eb492d5ad85541070bfff8fa?context=repo

issue.title: Unable to create a new project in the docker doccano/doccano image

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
If I follow the documented way of running `docker doccano/doccano` (not docker-compose): 
https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/master/docs/getting-started.md#docker 
 
I'm able to login, but I cannot create a new project. 
After setting all info, the "Create" button does nothing.

body:
@markuspoerschke 
It worked on my environment!
```
docker pull markuspoerschke/doccano:1.0.5
docker run -d --rm --name doccano105 -e "ADMIN_USERNAME=admin" -e "ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@example.com"  -e "ADMIN_PASSWORD=password" -p 8000:8000 markuspoerschke/doccano:1.0.5
```
I accessed http://192.168.99.100:8000 then create button worked. 
How did you get the old image of Doccano?

@markuspoerschke  Could you please elaborate the process of building an image and pushing it to Docker Hub.

I am in a deep complicated mess and would really appreciate some help. I am behind corporate proxy on RHEL. The routes to *.debian.org are blocked. So I cannot use the docker-compose up (gettiing DNS lookup error as it tried to download alpine and other images)

The only thing working for me in sercured environment is `docker container create --name doccano  -p 80:8000 doccano/doccano`. However this image has the older interface. But I am interested in the new interface.

Hypothetical solution - Build the image (new interface) on local PC and upload to Docker Hub. Followed up by docker pull on my secured server.

@markuspoerschke  Yes you're right. That was possible because of the Dockerfile in the github repo. However the image build by you has the older interface. I am looking for the new interface. It has much better features.

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

body:
Hello guys. Sorry for the late reply. I worked hard on another project in two weeks.

I recommend you should use the docker-compose version.

By the way, I investigate the problem and found the cause.
In #976, the file `app/server/static/components/projects.vue` was accidently edited.
I rolled back the file and pushed the image in #1024. Now you are able to create a project.

Regards,

issue.title: Can't create a new project (deployed by Heroku button)

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
Hello! I use Heroku button to deploy doccano and I can get into the webpage. However, when I click "Create" button to create project, nothing happen and the application log doesn't change anything. So I couldn't create any project now.
By the way, I also try to upload not by Heroku button but by myself using docker-compose, but the problem still remain. 

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30849777/94986690-4754c000-0593-11eb-8b4b-9c0032eeec37.JPG)
![app log](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30849777/94986710-62273480-0593-11eb-997c-4c55ed46f426.JPG)

How to solve the problem?

Your Environment
---------
*   Operating System: Windows 10
*   Python Version Used: Python 3.6.2
*   When you install doccano: 2020/10/2
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): Heroku button
